page.title: 18Gathering potatoes, Murroes
page.content: The potatoes start about 8.30am and finish at 4.30. There are 2 breaks, at 10am and 2.30pm. The farm uses a tractor, a bogey and a potato digger. You do half bits or whole bits. It is about{Â£30 a week}for a whole bit and{Â£15}for a half bit. When the digger has passed you get a basket and pick your bit. Then a tractor and bogey come along and empty your baskets. They then put all the potatoes into crates, the fork-lift comes and puts the crates on to the lorries. They are then taken away for storage. It is not always pleasant {gathering potatoes,}especially if it is cold or wet. You are often glad when it is 4.30, but the money comes in handy.
